snippet: In an attempt to prevent future housing crises, the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau is issuing new laws for lenders.
abstract: Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, in attempt to prevent future housing crises, is issuing new laws for lenders to take effect in January 2014; banks and other lenders will be prohibited from making home loans that offer deceptive teaser rates or require no documentation from borrowers, and will be required to take more steps to ensure that borrowers can repay.
lead_paragraph: In an attempt to prevent future housing crises, the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau is issuing new laws for lenders.

headline.seo: Consumers Win Some Mortgage Safety in New Rules
headline.main: U.S. Consumer Watchdog to Issue Mortgage Rules
headline.print_headline: U.S. Consumer Watchdog to Issue Mortgage Rules

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
